intro: Melandrium apetalum subsp. montanum, commonly known as the mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually pink or white, and it has hairy, narrow leaves. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes other flowering plants with similar characteristics. The species is adapted to cold climates and can thrive in well-drained soils.
